Browse the source code of netbsd/external/gpl3/gcc/dist/gcc/gimple-ssa-backprop.c

12but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
13MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the

17along with GCC; see the file COPYING3. If not see
18<http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>. */

20/* This pass propagates information that is common to all uses of an SSA
21 name back up through the sequence of statements that generate it,
22 simplifying the statements where possible. Sometimes this can expose
23 fully or partially dead code, but the main focus is simplifying
24 computations.
25
26 At the moment the pass only handles one piece of information: whether the
27 sign of a value matters, and therefore whether sign-changing operations
28 can be skipped. The pass could be extended to more interesting
29 information in future, such as which bits of an integer are significant.
30
31 For example, take the function:
32
33 double
34 f (double *a, int n, double start)
35 {
36 double x = fabs (start);
37 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
38 x *= a[i];
39 return __builtin_cos (x);
40 }
41
42 cos(x) == cos(-x), so the sign of the final x doesn't matter.
43 That x is the result of a series of multiplications, and if
44 the sign of the result of a multiplication doesn't matter,
45 the signs of the inputs don't matter either.
46
47 The pass would replace the incoming value of x (i.e. fabs(start))
48 with start. Since there are no other uses of the fabs result,
49 the call would get deleted as dead.
50
51 The algorithm is:
52
53 (1) Do a post-order traversal of the blocks in the function, walking
54 each block backwards. For each potentially-simplifiable statement
55 that defines an SSA name X, examine all uses of X to see what
56 information is actually significant. Record this as INFO_MAP[X].
57 Optimistically ignore for now any back-edge references to
58 unprocessed phis.
59
60 (An alternative would be to record each use when we visit its
61 statement and take the intersection as we go along. However,
62 this would lead to more SSA names being entered into INFO_MAP
63 unnecessarily, only to be taken out again later. At the moment
64 very few SSA names end up with useful information.)
65
66 (2) Iteratively reduce the optimistic result of (1) until we reach
67 a maximal fixed point (which at the moment would mean revisiting
68 statements at most once). First push all SSA names that used an
69 optimistic assumption about a backedge phi onto a worklist.
70 While the worklist is nonempty, pick off an SSA name X and recompute
71 INFO_MAP[X]. If the value changes, push all SSA names used in the
72 definition of X onto the worklist.
73
74 (3) Iterate over each SSA name X with info in INFO_MAP, in the
75 opposite order to (1), i.e. a forward reverse-post-order walk.
76 Try to optimize the definition of X using INFO_MAP[X] and fold
77 the result. (This ensures that we fold definitions before uses.)
78
79 (4) Iterate over each SSA name X with info in INFO_MAP, in the same
80 order as (1), and delete any statements that are now dead.
81 (This ensures that if a sequence of statements is dead,
82 we delete the last statement first.)
83
84 Note that this pass does not deal with direct redundancies,
85 such as cos(-x)->cos(x). match.pd handles those cases instead. */
86
87#include "config.h"
88#include "system.h"
89#include "coretypes.h"
90#include "backend.h"
91#include "tree.h"
92#include "gimple.h"
93#include "gimple-iterator.h"
94#include "ssa.h"
95#include "fold-const.h"
96#include "tree-pass.h"
97#include "cfganal.h"
98#include "gimple-pretty-print.h"
99#include "tree-cfg.h"
100#include "tree-ssa.h"
101#include "tree-ssa-propagate.h"
102#include "gimple-fold.h"
103#include "alloc-pool.h"
104#include "tree-hash-traits.h"
105#include "case-cfn-macros.h"
106
107namespace {
108
109/* Information about a group of uses of an SSA name. */
110struct usage_info
111{
112 usage_info () : flag_word (0) {}
113 usage_info &operator &= (const usage_info &);
114 usage_info operator & (const usage_info &) const;
115 bool operator == (const usage_info &) const;
116 bool operator != (const usage_info &) const;
117 bool is_useful () const;
118
119 static usage_info intersection_identity ();
120
121 union
122 {
123 struct
124 {
125 /* True if the uses treat x and -x in the same way. */
126 unsigned int ignore_sign : 1;
127 } flags;
128 /* All the flag bits as a single int. */
129 unsigned int flag_word;
130 };
131};
132
133/* Return an X such that X & Y == Y for all Y. This is the most
134 optimistic assumption possible. */
135
136usage_info
137usage_info::intersection_identity ()
138{
139 usage_info ret;
140 ret.flag_word = -1;
141 return ret;
142}
143
144/* Intersect *THIS with OTHER, so that *THIS describes all uses covered
145 by the original *THIS and OTHER. */
146
147usage_info &
148usage_info::operator &= (const usage_info &other)
149{
150 flag_word &= other.flag_word;
151 return *this;
152}
153
154/* Return the intersection of *THIS and OTHER, i.e. a structure that
155 describes all uses covered by *THIS and OTHER. */
156
157usage_info
158usage_info::operator & (const usage_info &other) const
159{
160 usage_info info (*this);
161 info &= other;
162 return info;
163}
164
165bool
166usage_info::operator == (const usage_info &other) const
167{
168 return flag_word == other.flag_word;
169}
170
171bool
172usage_info::operator != (const usage_info &other) const
173{
174 return !operator == (other);
175}
176
177/* Return true if *THIS is not simply the default, safe assumption. */
178
179bool
180usage_info::is_useful () const
181{
182 return flag_word != 0;
183}
184
185/* Start a dump line about SSA name VAR. */
186
187static void
188dump_usage_prefix (FILE *file, tree var)
189{
190 fprintf (file, " ");
191 print_generic_expr (file, var, 0);
192 fprintf (file, ": ");
193}
194
195/* Print INFO to FILE. */
196
197static void
198dump_usage_info (FILE *file, tree var, usage_info *info)
199{
200 if (info->flags.ignore_sign)
201 {
202 dump_usage_prefix (file, var);
203 fprintf (file, "sign bit not important\n");
204 }
205}
206
207/* Represents one execution of the pass. */
208class backprop
209{
210public:
211 backprop (function *);
212 ~backprop ();
213
214 void execute ();
215
216private:
217 const usage_info *lookup_operand (tree);
218
219 void push_to_worklist (tree);
220 tree pop_from_worklist ();
221
222 void process_builtin_call_use (gcall *, tree, usage_info *);
223 void process_assign_use (gassign *, tree, usage_info *);
224 void process_phi_use (gphi *, usage_info *);
225 void process_use (gimple *, tree, usage_info *);
226 bool intersect_uses (tree, usage_info *);
227 void reprocess_inputs (gimple *);
228 void process_var (tree);
229 void process_block (basic_block);
230
231 void prepare_change (tree);
232 void complete_change (gimple *);
233 void optimize_builtin_call (gcall *, tree, const usage_info *);
234 void replace_assign_rhs (gassign *, tree, tree, tree, tree);
235 void optimize_assign (gassign *, tree, const usage_info *);
236 void optimize_phi (gphi *, tree, const usage_info *);
237
238 typedef hash_map <tree_ssa_name_hash, usage_info *> info_map_type;
239 typedef std::pair <tree, usage_info *> var_info_pair;
240
241 /* The function we're optimizing. */
242 function *m_fn;
243
244 /* Pool for allocating usage_info structures. */
245 object_allocator <usage_info> m_info_pool;
246
247 /* Maps an SSA name to a description of all uses of that SSA name.
248 All the usage_infos satisfy is_useful.
249
250 We use a hash_map because the map is expected to be sparse
251 (i.e. most SSA names won't have useful information attached to them).
252 We could move to a directly-indexed array if that situation changes. */
253 info_map_type m_info_map;
254
255 /* Post-ordered list of all potentially-interesting SSA names,
256 along with information that describes all uses. */
257 auto_vec <var_info_pair, 128> m_vars;
258
259 /* A bitmap of blocks that we have finished processing in the initial
260 post-order walk. */
261 auto_sbitmap m_visited_blocks;
262
263 /* A bitmap of phis that we have finished processing in the initial
264 post-order walk, excluding those from blocks mentioned in
265 M_VISITED_BLOCKS. */
266 auto_bitmap m_visited_phis;
267
268 /* A worklist of SSA names whose definitions need to be reconsidered. */
269 auto_vec <tree, 64> m_worklist;
270
271 /* The SSA names in M_WORKLIST, identified by their SSA_NAME_VERSION.
272 We use a bitmap rather than an sbitmap because most SSA names are
273 never added to the worklist. */
274 bitmap m_worklist_names;
275};
276
277backprop::backprop (function *fn)
278 : m_fn (fn),
279 m_info_pool ("usage_info"),
280 m_visited_blocks (last_basic_block_for_fn (m_fn)),
281 m_worklist_names (BITMAP_ALLOC (NULL))
282{
283 bitmap_clear (m_visited_blocks);
284}
285
286backprop::~backprop ()
287{
288 BITMAP_FREE (m_worklist_names);
289 m_info_pool.release ();
290}
291
292/* Return usage information for general operand OP, or null if none. */
293
294const usage_info *
295backprop::lookup_operand (tree op)
296{
297 if (op && TREE_CODE (op) == SSA_NAME)
298 {
299 usage_info **slot = m_info_map.get (op);
300 if (slot)
301 return *slot;
302 }
303 return NULL;
304}
305
306/* Add SSA name VAR to the worklist, if it isn't on the worklist already. */
307
308void
309backprop::push_to_worklist (tree var)
310{
311 if (!bitmap_set_bit (m_worklist_names, SSA_NAME_VERSION (var)))
312 return;
313 m_worklist.safe_push (var);
314 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
315 {
316 fprintf (dump_file, "[WORKLIST] Pushing ");
317 print_generic_expr (dump_file, var, 0);
318 fprintf (dump_file, "\n");
319 }
320}
321
322/* Remove and return the next SSA name from the worklist. The worklist
323 is known to be nonempty. */
324
325tree
326backprop::pop_from_worklist ()
327{
328 tree var = m_worklist.pop ();
329 bitmap_clear_bit (m_worklist_names, SSA_NAME_VERSION (var));
330 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
331 {
332 fprintf (dump_file, "[WORKLIST] Popping ");
333 print_generic_expr (dump_file, var, 0);
334 fprintf (dump_file, "\n");
335 }
336 return var;
337}
338
339/* Make INFO describe all uses of RHS in CALL, which is a call to a
340 built-in function. */
341
342void
343backprop::process_builtin_call_use (gcall *call, tree rhs, usage_info *info)
344{
345 combined_fn fn = gimple_call_combined_fn (call);
346 tree lhs = gimple_call_lhs (call);
347 switch (fn)
348 {
349 case CFN_LAST:
350 break;
351
352 CASE_CFN_COS:
353 CASE_CFN_COSH:
354 CASE_CFN_CCOS:
355 CASE_CFN_CCOSH:
356 CASE_CFN_HYPOT:
357 /* The signs of all inputs are ignored. */
358 info->flags.ignore_sign = true;
359 break;
360
361 CASE_CFN_COPYSIGN:
362 /* The sign of the first input is ignored. */
363 if (rhs != gimple_call_arg (call, 1))
364 info->flags.ignore_sign = true;
365 break;
366
367 CASE_CFN_POW:
368 {
369 /* The sign of the first input is ignored as long as the second
370 input is an even real. */
371 tree power = gimple_call_arg (call, 1);
372 HOST_WIDE_INT n;
373 if (TREE_CODE (power) == REAL_CST
374 && real_isinteger (&TREE_REAL_CST (power), &n)
375 && (n & 1) == 0)
376 info->flags.ignore_sign = true;
377 break;
378 }
379
380 CASE_CFN_FMA:
381 /* In X * X + Y, where Y is distinct from X, the sign of X doesn't
382 matter. */
383 if (gimple_call_arg (call, 0) == rhs
384 && gimple_call_arg (call, 1) == rhs
385 && gimple_call_arg (call, 2) != rhs)
386 info->flags.ignore_sign = true;
387 break;
388
389 default:
390 if (negate_mathfn_p (fn))
391 {
392 /* The sign of the (single) input doesn't matter provided
393 that the sign of the output doesn't matter. */
394 const usage_info *lhs_info = lookup_operand (lhs);
395 if (lhs_info)
396 info->flags.ignore_sign = lhs_info->flags.ignore_sign;
397 }
398 break;
399 }
400}
401
402/* Make INFO describe all uses of RHS in ASSIGN. */
403
404void
405backprop::process_assign_use (gassign *assign, tree rhs, usage_info *info)
406{
407 tree lhs = gimple_assign_lhs (assign);
408 switch (gimple_assign_rhs_code (assign))
409 {
410 case ABS_EXPR:
411 /* The sign of the input doesn't matter. */
412 info->flags.ignore_sign = true;
413 break;
414
415 case COND_EXPR:
416 /* For A = B ? C : D, propagate information about all uses of A
417 to C and D. */
418 if (rhs != gimple_assign_rhs1 (assign))
419 {
420 const usage_info *lhs_info = lookup_operand (lhs);
421 if (lhs_info)
422 *info = *lhs_info;
423 }
424 break;
425
426 case FMA_EXPR:
427 /* In X * X + Y, where Y is distinct from X, the sign of X doesn't
428 matter. */
429 if (gimple_assign_rhs1 (assign) == rhs
430 && gimple_assign_rhs2 (assign) == rhs
431 && gimple_assign_rhs3 (assign) != rhs)
432 info->flags.ignore_sign = true;
433 break;
434
435 case MULT_EXPR:
436 /* In X * X, the sign of X doesn't matter. */
437 if (gimple_assign_rhs1 (assign) == rhs
438 && gimple_assign_rhs2 (assign) == rhs)
439 info->flags.ignore_sign = true;
440 /* Fall through. */
441
442 case NEGATE_EXPR:
443 case RDIV_EXPR:
444 /* If the sign of the result doesn't matter, the sign of the inputs
445 doesn't matter either. */
446 if (FLOAT_TYPE_P (TREE_TYPE (rhs)))
447 {
448 const usage_info *lhs_info = lookup_operand (lhs);
449 if (lhs_info)
450 info->flags.ignore_sign = lhs_info->flags.ignore_sign;
451 }
452 break;
453
454 default:
455 break;
456 }
457}
458
459/* Make INFO describe the uses of PHI's result. */
460
461void
462backprop::process_phi_use (gphi *phi, usage_info *info)
463{
464 tree result = gimple_phi_result (phi);
465 if (const usage_info *result_info = lookup_operand (result))
466 *info = *result_info;
467}
468
469/* Make INFO describe all uses of RHS in STMT. */
470
471void
472backprop::process_use (gimple *stmt, tree rhs, usage_info *info)
473{
474 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
475 {
476 fprintf (dump_file, "[USE] ");
477 print_generic_expr (dump_file, rhs, 0);
478 fprintf (dump_file, " in ");
479 print_gimple_stmt (dump_file, stmt, 0, TDF_SLIM);
480 }
481
482 if (gcall *call = dyn_cast <gcall *> (stmt))
483 process_builtin_call_use (call, rhs, info);
484 else if (gassign *assign = dyn_cast <gassign *> (stmt))
485 process_assign_use (assign, rhs, info);
486 else if (gphi *phi = dyn_cast <gphi *> (stmt))
487 process_phi_use (phi, info);
488
489 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
490 dump_usage_info (dump_file, rhs, info);
491}
492
493/* Make INFO describe all uses of VAR, returning true if the result
494 is useful. If the uses include phis that haven't been processed yet,
495 make the most optimistic assumption possible, so that we aim for
496 a maximum rather than a minimum fixed point. */
497
498bool
499backprop::intersect_uses (tree var, usage_info *info)
500{
501 imm_use_iterator iter;
502 gimple *stmt;
503 *info = usage_info::intersection_identity ();
504 FOR_EACH_IMM_USE_STMT (stmt, iter, var)
505 {
506 if (is_gimple_debug (stmt))
507 continue;
508 gphi *phi = dyn_cast <gphi *> (stmt);
509 if (phi
510 && !bitmap_bit_p (m_visited_blocks, gimple_bb (phi)->index)
511 && !bitmap_bit_p (m_visited_phis,
512 SSA_NAME_VERSION (gimple_phi_result (phi))))
513 {
514 /* Skip unprocessed phis. */
515 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
516 {
517 fprintf (dump_file, "[BACKEDGE] ");
518 print_generic_expr (dump_file, var, 0);
519 fprintf (dump_file, " in ");
520 print_gimple_stmt (dump_file, phi, 0, TDF_SLIM);
521 }
522 }
523 else
524 {
525 usage_info subinfo;
526 process_use (stmt, var, &subinfo);
527 *info &= subinfo;
528 if (!info->is_useful ())
529 {
530 BREAK_FROM_IMM_USE_STMT (iter);
531 return false;
532 }
533 }
534 }
535 return true;
536}
537
538/* Queue for reconsideration any input of STMT that has information
539 associated with it. This is used if that information might be
540 too optimistic. */
541
542void
543backprop::reprocess_inputs (gimple *stmt)
544{
545 use_operand_p use_p;
546 ssa_op_iter oi;
547 FOR_EACH_PHI_OR_STMT_USE (use_p, stmt, oi, SSA_OP_USE)
548 {
549 tree var = get_use_from_ptr (use_p);
550 if (lookup_operand (var))
551 push_to_worklist (var);
552 }
553}
554
555/* Say that we're recording INFO for SSA name VAR, or that we're deleting
556 existing information if INFO is null. INTRO describes the change. */
557
558static void
559dump_var_info (tree var, usage_info *info, const char *intro)
560{
561 fprintf (dump_file, "[DEF] %s for ", intro);
562 print_gimple_stmt (dump_file, SSA_NAME_DEF_STMT (var), 0, TDF_SLIM);
563 if (info)
564 dump_usage_info (dump_file, var, info);
565}
566
567/* Process all uses of VAR and record or update the result in
568 M_INFO_MAP and M_VARS. */
569
570void
571backprop::process_var (tree var)
572{
573 if (has_zero_uses (var))
574 return;
575
576 usage_info info;
577 intersect_uses (var, &info);
578
579 gimple *stmt = SSA_NAME_DEF_STMT (var);
580 if (info.is_useful ())
581 {
582 bool existed;
583 usage_info *&map_info = m_info_map.get_or_insert (var, &existed);
584 if (!existed)
585 {
586 /* Recording information about VAR for the first time. */
587 map_info = m_info_pool.allocate ();
588 *map_info = info;
589 m_vars.safe_push (var_info_pair (var, map_info));
590 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
591 dump_var_info (var, map_info, "Recording new information");
592
593 /* If STMT is a phi, reprocess any backedge uses. This is a
594 no-op for other uses, which won't have any information
595 associated with them. */
596 if (is_a <gphi *> (stmt))
597 reprocess_inputs (stmt);
598 }
599 else if (info != *map_info)
600 {
601 /* Recording information that is less optimistic than before. */
602 gcc_checking_assert ((info & *map_info) == info);
603 *map_info = info;
604 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
605 dump_var_info (var, map_info, "Updating information");
606 reprocess_inputs (stmt);
607 }
608 }
609 else
610 {
611 if (usage_info **slot = m_info_map.get (var))
612 {
613 /* Removing previously-recorded information. */
614 **slot = info;
615 m_info_map.remove (var);
616 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
617 dump_var_info (var, NULL, "Deleting information");
618 reprocess_inputs (stmt);
619 }
620 else
621 {
622 /* If STMT is a phi, remove any information recorded for
623 its arguments. */
624 if (is_a <gphi *> (stmt))
625 reprocess_inputs (stmt);
626 }
627 }
628}
629
630/* Process all statements and phis in BB, during the first post-order walk. */
631
632void
633backprop::process_block (basic_block bb)
634{
635 for (gimple_stmt_iterator gsi = gsi_last_bb (bb); !gsi_end_p (gsi);
636 gsi_prev (&gsi))
637 {
638 tree lhs = gimple_get_lhs (gsi_stmt (gsi));
639 if (lhs && TREE_CODE (lhs) == SSA_NAME)
640 process_var (lhs);
641 }
642 for (gphi_iterator gpi = gsi_start_phis (bb); !gsi_end_p (gpi);
643 gsi_next (&gpi))
644 {
645 tree result = gimple_phi_result (gpi.phi ());
646 process_var (result);
647 bitmap_set_bit (m_visited_phis, SSA_NAME_VERSION (result));
648 }
649 bitmap_clear (m_visited_phis);
650}
651
652/* Delete the definition of VAR, which has no uses. */
653
654static void
655remove_unused_var (tree var)
656{
657 gimple *stmt = SSA_NAME_DEF_STMT (var);
658 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
659 {
660 fprintf (dump_file, "Deleting ");
661 print_gimple_stmt (dump_file, stmt, 0, TDF_SLIM);
662 }
663 gimple_stmt_iterator gsi = gsi_for_stmt (stmt);
664 gsi_remove (&gsi, true);
665 release_defs (stmt);
666}
667
668/* Note that we're replacing OLD_RHS with NEW_RHS in STMT. */
669
670static void
671note_replacement (gimple *stmt, tree old_rhs, tree new_rhs)
672{
673 fprintf (dump_file, "Replacing use of ");
674 print_generic_expr (dump_file, old_rhs, 0);
675 fprintf (dump_file, " with ");
676 print_generic_expr (dump_file, new_rhs, 0);
677 fprintf (dump_file, " in ");
678 print_gimple_stmt (dump_file, stmt, 0, TDF_SLIM);
679}
680
681/* If RHS is an SSA name whose definition just changes the sign of a value,
682 return that other value, otherwise return null. */
683
684static tree
685strip_sign_op_1 (tree rhs)
686{
687 if (TREE_CODE (rhs) != SSA_NAME)
688 return NULL_TREE;
689
690 gimple *def_stmt = SSA_NAME_DEF_STMT (rhs);
691 if (gassign *assign = dyn_cast <gassign *> (def_stmt))
692 switch (gimple_assign_rhs_code (assign))
693 {
694 case ABS_EXPR:
695 case NEGATE_EXPR:
696 return gimple_assign_rhs1 (assign);
697
698 default:
699 break;
700 }
701 else if (gcall *call = dyn_cast <gcall *> (def_stmt))
702 switch (gimple_call_combined_fn (call))
703 {
704 CASE_CFN_COPYSIGN:
705 return gimple_call_arg (call, 0);
706
707 default:
708 break;
709 }
710
711 return NULL_TREE;
712}
713
714/* If RHS is an SSA name whose definition just changes the sign of a value,
715 strip all such operations and return the ultimate input to them.
716 Return null otherwise.
717
718 Although this could in principle lead to quadratic searching,
719 in practice a long sequence of sign manipulations should already
720 have been folded down. E.g. --x -> x, abs(-x) -> abs(x). We search
721 for more than one operation in order to catch cases like -abs(x). */
722
723static tree
724strip_sign_op (tree rhs)
725{
726 tree new_rhs = strip_sign_op_1 (rhs);
727 if (!new_rhs)
728 return NULL_TREE;
729 while (tree next = strip_sign_op_1 (new_rhs))
730 new_rhs = next;
731 return new_rhs;
732}
733
734/* Start a change in the value of VAR that is suitable for all non-debug
735 uses of VAR. We need to make sure that debug statements continue to
736 use the original definition of VAR where possible, or are nullified
737 otherwise. */
738
739void
740backprop::prepare_change (tree var)
741{
742 if (MAY_HAVE_DEBUG_STMTS)
743 insert_debug_temp_for_var_def (NULL, var);
744 reset_flow_sensitive_info (var);
745}
746
747/* STMT has been changed. Give the fold machinery a chance to simplify
748 and canonicalize it (e.g. by ensuring that commutative operands have
749 the right order), then record the updates. */
750
751void
752backprop::complete_change (gimple *stmt)
753{
754 gimple_stmt_iterator gsi = gsi_for_stmt (stmt);
755 if (fold_stmt (&gsi))
756 {
757 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
758 {
759 fprintf (dump_file, " which folds to: ");
760 print_gimple_stmt (dump_file, gsi_stmt (gsi), 0, TDF_SLIM);
761 }
762 }
763 update_stmt (gsi_stmt (gsi));
764}
765
766/* Optimize CALL, a call to a built-in function with lhs LHS, on the
767 basis that INFO describes all uses of LHS. */
768
769void
770backprop::optimize_builtin_call (gcall *call, tree lhs, const usage_info *info)
771{
772 /* If we have an f such that -f(x) = f(-x), and if the sign of the result
773 doesn't matter, strip any sign operations from the input. */
774 if (info->flags.ignore_sign
775 && negate_mathfn_p (gimple_call_combined_fn (call)))
776 {
777 tree new_arg = strip_sign_op (gimple_call_arg (call, 0));
778 if (new_arg)
779 {
780 prepare_change (lhs);
781 gimple_call_set_arg (call, 0, new_arg);
782 complete_change (call);
783 }
784 }
785}
786
787/* Optimize ASSIGN, an assignment to LHS, by replacing rhs operand N
788 with RHS<N>, if RHS<N> is nonnull. This may change the value of LHS. */
789
790void
791backprop::replace_assign_rhs (gassign *assign, tree lhs, tree rhs1,
792 tree rhs2, tree rhs3)
793{
794 if (!rhs1 && !rhs2 && !rhs3)
795 return;
796
797 prepare_change (lhs);
798 if (rhs1)
799 gimple_assign_set_rhs1 (assign, rhs1);
800 if (rhs2)
801 gimple_assign_set_rhs2 (assign, rhs2);
802 if (rhs3)
803 gimple_assign_set_rhs3 (assign, rhs3);
804 complete_change (assign);
805}
806
807/* Optimize ASSIGN, an assignment to LHS, on the basis that INFO
808 describes all uses of LHS. */
809
810void
811backprop::optimize_assign (gassign *assign, tree lhs, const usage_info *info)
812{
813 switch (gimple_assign_rhs_code (assign))
814 {
815 case MULT_EXPR:
816 case RDIV_EXPR:
817 /* If the sign of the result doesn't matter, strip sign operations
818 from both inputs. */
819 if (info->flags.ignore_sign)
820 replace_assign_rhs (assign, lhs,
821 strip_sign_op (gimple_assign_rhs1 (assign)),
822 strip_sign_op (gimple_assign_rhs2 (assign)),
823 NULL_TREE);
824 break;
825
826 case COND_EXPR:
827 /* If the sign of A ? B : C doesn't matter, strip sign operations
828 from both B and C. */
829 if (info->flags.ignore_sign)
830 replace_assign_rhs (assign, lhs,
831 NULL_TREE,
832 strip_sign_op (gimple_assign_rhs2 (assign)),
833 strip_sign_op (gimple_assign_rhs3 (assign)));
834 break;
835
836 default:
837 break;
838 }
839}
840
841/* Optimize PHI, which defines VAR, on the basis that INFO describes all
842 uses of the result. */
843
844void
845backprop::optimize_phi (gphi *phi, tree var, const usage_info *info)
846{
847 /* If the sign of the result doesn't matter, try to strip sign operations
848 from arguments. */
849 if (info->flags.ignore_sign)
850 {
851 basic_block bb = gimple_bb (phi);
852 use_operand_p use;
853 ssa_op_iter oi;
854 bool replaced = false;
855 FOR_EACH_PHI_ARG (use, phi, oi, SSA_OP_USE)
856 {
857 /* Propagating along abnormal edges is delicate, punt for now. */
858 const int index = PHI_ARG_INDEX_FROM_USE (use);
859 if (EDGE_PRED (bb, index)->flags & EDGE_ABNORMAL)
860 continue;
861
862 tree new_arg = strip_sign_op (USE_FROM_PTR (use));
863 if (new_arg)
864 {
865 if (!replaced)
866 prepare_change (var);
867 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
868 note_replacement (phi, USE_FROM_PTR (use), new_arg);
869 replace_exp (use, new_arg);
870 replaced = true;
871 }
872 }
873 }
874}
875
876void
877backprop::execute ()
878{
879 /* Phase 1: Traverse the function, making optimistic assumptions
880 about any phi whose definition we haven't seen. */
881 int *postorder = XNEWVEC (int, n_basic_blocks_for_fn (m_fn));
882 unsigned int postorder_num = post_order_compute (postorder, false, false);
883 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < postorder_num; ++i)
884 {
885 process_block (BASIC_BLOCK_FOR_FN (m_fn, postorder[i]));
886 bitmap_set_bit (m_visited_blocks, postorder[i]);
887 }
888 XDELETEVEC (postorder);
889
890 /* Phase 2: Use the initial (perhaps overly optimistic) information
891 to create a maximal fixed point solution. */
892 while (!m_worklist.is_empty ())
893 process_var (pop_from_worklist ());
894
895 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
896 fprintf (dump_file, "\n");
897
898 /* Phase 3: Do a reverse post-order walk, using information about
899 the uses of SSA names to optimize their definitions. */
900 for (unsigned int i = m_vars.length (); i-- > 0;)
901 {
902 usage_info *info = m_vars[i].second;
903 if (info->is_useful ())
904 {
905 tree var = m_vars[i].first;
906 gimple *stmt = SSA_NAME_DEF_STMT (var);
907 if (gcall *call = dyn_cast <gcall *> (stmt))
908 optimize_builtin_call (call, var, info);
909 else if (gassign *assign = dyn_cast <gassign *> (stmt))
910 optimize_assign (assign, var, info);
911 else if (gphi *phi = dyn_cast <gphi *> (stmt))
912 optimize_phi (phi, var, info);
913 }
914 }
915
916 /* Phase 4: Do a post-order walk, deleting statements that are no
917 longer needed. */
918 for (unsigned int i = 0; i < m_vars.length (); ++i)
919 {
920 tree var = m_vars[i].first;
921 if (has_zero_uses (var))
922 remove_unused_var (var);
923 }
924
925 if (dump_file && (dump_flags & TDF_DETAILS))
926 fprintf (dump_file, "\n");
927}
928
929const pass_data pass_data_backprop =
930{
931 GIMPLE_PASS, /* type */
932 "backprop", /* name */
933 OPTGROUP_NONE, /* optinfo_flags */
934 TV_TREE_BACKPROP, /* tv_id */
935 ( PROP_cfg | PROP_ssa ), /* properties_required */
936 0, /* properties_provided */
937 0, /* properties_destroyed */
938 0, /* todo_flags_start */
939 0, /* todo_flags_finish */
940};
941
942class pass_backprop : public gimple_opt_pass
943{
944public:
945 pass_backprop (gcc::context *ctxt)
946 : gimple_opt_pass (pass_data_backprop, ctxt)
947 {}
948
949 /* opt_pass methods: */
950 opt_pass * clone () { return new pass_backprop (m_ctxt); }
951 virtual bool gate (function *) { return flag_ssa_backprop; }
952 virtual unsigned int execute (function *);
953
954}; // class pass_backprop
955
956unsigned int
957pass_backprop::execute (function *fn)
958{
959 backprop (fn).execute ();
960 return 0;
961}
962
963} // anon namespace
964
965gimple_opt_pass *
966make_pass_backprop (gcc::context *ctxt)
967{
968 return new pass_backprop (ctxt);
969}
